[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: ModuleBundle] [Bundle Versioning] Can ModuleBundle contain modules of different bytecode versions, causing compatibility issues during execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: Module] [Non-Deterministic Hashing] Can the Hash implementation produce non-deterministic results across different platforms, causing consensus failures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: Module] [Equality Determinism] Does the Eq implementation guarantee deterministic comparisons, or can floating-point NaN or other edge cases cause consensus divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: ModuleBundle] [Iteration Order] Is the iteration order of ModuleBundle::iter() deterministic across all validator implementations, or can ordering differences cause state divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Function: ModuleBundle::into_inner()] [Conversion Determinism] Does into_inner() produce deterministic output regardless of platform, compiler version, or optimization level? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: Module] [Direct Construction] Can attackers construct Module objects directly in malicious transactions to bypass transaction validation checks that assume modules come from specific sources? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: ModuleBundle] [Bundle Validation Bypass] Does creating ModuleBundle through different code paths (new() vs From<Module>) have different validation requirements, allowing validation bypass? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: Module] [Allocation Attack] Can an attacker trigger pathological allocation patterns in Module::new() by providing bytecode sizes that defeat allocator optimizations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: ModuleBundle] [Bundle Allocation] Can ModuleBundle::new() with many small modules fragment the heap, causing performance degradation over time? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Function: Module::code()] [Reference Overhead] If code() is called repeatedly on the same module, can excessive reference creation cause CPU overhead in reference counting? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: Module] [Type Invariants] What invariants should Module maintain (e.g., non-empty bytecode, valid Move bytecode), and can their violation cause safety issues? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: ModuleBundle] [Bundle Invariants] Does ModuleBundle enforce invariants like non-empty codes vector or unique modules, and can their violation enable attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: Module] [Encapsulation Breach] Can external code modify the private code field through unsafe code or serialization exploits, breaking encapsulation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Function: Module::new()] [Error Handling] Does Module::new() return Result or panic on invalid input, and can panic propagation crash validator threads? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Function: ModuleBundle::new()] [Empty Input] How does ModuleBundle::new() handle empty codes vector - does it panic, return error, or create invalid state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Function: Module::into_inner()] [Panic Safety] Can into_inner() panic in any edge cases, and if so, can panic unwinding leave state in inconsistent condition? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: Module] [Hash Quality] What hash algorithm is used by the derived Hash trait, and is it cryptographically secure enough to prevent practical collision attacks? (High)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: Module] [Hash Seed] Is the hash implementation seeded, and can attackers exploit predictable hash seeds for hash flooding attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: Module] [Module Identity] How is module uniqueness determined - by hash, by name in bytecode, or by address? Can identity confusion enable replay attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: ModuleBundle] [Bundle Identity] How are ModuleBundle transactions identified for replay protection, and can identical bundles be submitted multiple times? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: Module] [Cross-Platform] Does Module serialization/deserialization work identically on different architectures (x86, ARM, endianness), preventing consensus splits? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: ModuleBundle] [Serialization Format] Is the ModuleBundle serialization format stable across Rust compiler versions and optimization levels? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: Module] [Bytecode Format] Does Module validate the bytecode format version header, or can incompatible bytecode versions cause VM crashes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: Module] [Bytecode Limits] Are there enforced limits on bytecode size, function count, or complexity stored in Module to prevent VM overload? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: ModuleBundle] [Module Dependencies] Can ModuleBundle validation check that all module dependencies are satisfied within the bundle, preventing dangling references? (High)
